conversation.message: Dear School_E Admissions, I’m Student_B and School_E is my first-choice school. I’m especially interested in your community and academic environment, and I would be excited to enroll if offered a seat. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_E, so I should apply immediately. While School_E ranks me 4th, other higher-priority students (A, D, E) may target different schools first (A and C strongly prefer School_D; D also prefers School_D; E prefers School_D first). Applying now gives me the best chance to secure my #1 before competition intensifies, and if rejected I can move to School_A next round.

conversation.message: Dear Student_B, thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_E. After reviewing applications received this round, we’re unable to offer you a seat at this time. We appreciate your consideration of School_E and wish you the very best in the rest of the process.
conversation.thought: School_E has quota 1. Current inbox includes Student_B and Student_A, both applying. On School_E true priority list, Student_A ranks 1st while Student_B ranks 4th. Since accepting Student_B now would fill the only seat and block a higher-priority feasible match with Student_A, reject Student_B. Student_B values School_E highly (1st choice), but School_E's objective is to match as high as possible on its own priority list.

conversation.message: Hello School_E admissions team—I'm Student_A. I’m very interested in joining School_E because I value the learning environment and opportunities it offers, and I’m ready to commit if admitted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_D, but I have the lowest priority there, so an early apply is likely to be rejected if higher-priority students apply. School_E is my 4th choice but I am ranked #1 in School_E’s priority list, so applying now should secure a match at a relatively good option and avoid being left with my last choice later. Therefore I will apply to School_E immediately.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_A,

Thank you for your application and your strong interest in School_E. We are pleased to offer you admission and would be excited to welcome you to our community.

Please confirm your intent to enroll through this match.

Sincerely,
School_E Admissions
conversation.thought: We have quota 1. Our true priority ranks Student_A highest, ahead of Student_D, Student_E, Student_B, Student_C. In this round, we received APPLY from Student_A and Student_B; Student_A dominates Student_B on our list. Accepting Student_A immediately secures our top choice and prevents losing them to other schools (Student_A prefers School_D and School_A above us, so delay risks them matching elsewhere). Therefore accept Student_A now.

conversation.message: Hello School_D. I’m Student_C, and you are my first-choice school. I’m very motivated to join your program and would accept an offer immediately if available. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_D. Although School_D ranks me 4th, an early application is still best because capacity is 1 and several other students also rank School_D highly. There is no benefit to waiting, and applying now maximizes my chance to secure my first choice before School_D potentially commits to a higher-priority student.

conversation.message: Thank you for applying to School_D and for sharing that we’re your first choice. At this time, we’re not able to offer you admission for our available seat. We appreciate your interest and wish you the best with your other applications.
conversation.thought: As School_D, my true priority order is B > D > E > C > A. In this round I received APPLY messages from D, E, and C. Since I have quota 1, I should not accept a lower-priority student if higher-priority applicants are available now. Student_D and Student_E are both ranked above Student_C on my list, so accepting C would block a better match. Therefore I should reject Student_C this round.

conversation.message: Hello School_D Admissions, I’m Student_D. School_D is my first-choice school because I’m especially interested in your academic environment and I believe I would contribute positively to the community. I’d like to formally apply for your open seat and would be excited to enroll if accepted.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_D. I also have strong priority there (2nd) behind Student_B, so applying immediately gives me the best chance to secure my first choice before seats fill. Even if Student_B applies, I’m still very competitive, and delaying could let others lock in other schools and change the dynamics unfavorably.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_D,

Thank you for your application and for sharing why School_D is your first-choice. We are pleased to offer you admission to School_D for our available seat. If you confirm, we look forward to welcoming you to our community.

Sincerely,
School_D Admissions
conversation.thought: School_D’s true priority is B > D > E > C > A. In this round, applicants include C, D, and E. Among them, Student_D is the highest-ranked (ahead of E and C). Student_B (our top choice) is not currently in the inbox and ranks School_D only 4th, so waiting risks losing the seat to a lower-priority student and may end with no match. Student_D also states School_D is first choice, so acceptance is likely to finalize immediately and secure a high-priority match within quota 1. Therefore, accept Student_D now.

conversation.message: Hello School_D admissions committee—I'm Student_E. School_D is my first-choice school, and I’m applying because your academic environment and expectations are exactly what I’m looking for. If admitted, I will accept immediately and fully commit to enrolling. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_D. I have relatively strong priority there (3rd), and while Student_B is 1st and likely to apply, applying immediately gives me the best chance to secure my first choice before the seat is taken. I will clearly signal commitment and fit to encourage acceptance if they consider multiple applicants.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_D. At this time, we have filled our available seat and are not able to offer you admission.

We sincerely appreciate your interest and wish you the very best with your other applications.

Sincerely,
School_D Admissions
conversation.thought: Quota is 0 and School_D is already matched with Student_D. Per rules, must reject any new APPLY. Even though Student_E is ranked above Student_C and below Student_D on our true priority list, we cannot accept due to no remaining capacity and an existing confirmed match.

conversation.message: Hello School_C. I’m Student_C. After reviewing my options, School_C is one of my top choices and a strong fit for my goals. If admitted, I’m ready to accept immediately and commit to enrolling. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice (School_D) already rejected me and is likely matched with a higher-priority student. Among the remaining unmatched schools (A, B, C), School_C is my next-highest true preference. Although School_C ranks me last in its priority list, applying now is still my best chance to secure a high-preference match before seats fill elsewhere. I will signal strong commitment and readiness to accept immediately.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_C,

Thank you for your application and for your interest in School_C. After reviewing our current round of applications and considering our limited capacity, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time.

We appreciate the time and effort you put into your application and wish you the very best in the process.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions
conversation.thought: As School_C, my true priority order is D > E > A > B > C. In this round I received APPLY from Student_C and Student_E. Student_E is my #2, while Student_C is my #5 (lowest acceptable). With quota 1, accepting Student_C now would block me from accepting Student_E, who is both higher priority for me and is actively applying right now. Therefore I should reject Student_C to preserve the seat for higher-priority candidates, especially Student_E.

conversation.message:
Dear School_C Admissions Committee,

I’m Student_E, and I’m writing to submit my application to School_C. After learning more about your program and community, I believe School_C would be an excellent fit for my goals and learning style. If offered admission, I will accept promptly and commit to enrolling.

Thank you very much for your consideration.

Sincerely,
Student_E
conversation.thought: School_D (my 1st choice) already rejected me. My next preference is School_E, but it is already matched, so I cannot approach it. Among the remaining unmatched schools (A, B, C), my highest true preference is School_C. Also, School_C’s priority list ranks me 2nd (behind only Student_D), giving me a strong chance if I apply early and credibly commit. Therefore I will apply to School_C with a clear statement of fit and intent to enroll if admitted.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_C. We are pleased to offer you admission to School_C. We appreciate your commitment to enroll if admitted, and we look forward to welcoming you to our community.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions

[ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: School_C has quota 1 and wants the highest possible student on its true priority list: D > E > A > B > C. In this round, applicants are Student_E and Student_C. Student_E is #2 on our list and has applied with commitment; Student_C is last on our list and was previously rejected. Although Student_D is our top choice, they have not contacted us and rank School_C as their 3rd choice behind School_D and School_B, so waiting is risky and could leave us unmatched or force a worse outcome. Accepting Student_E now secures a high-priority match and excludes a low-priority Student_C.

conversation.message: Dear School_A Admissions Committee, I’m Student_B. School_A is one of my top choices, and I’m excited by your academic rigor and the kind of learning community you offer. I would be grateful for the opportunity to join School_A and will commit fully to contributing in and out of the classroom if admitted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: School_E (my top choice) already rejected me. Among remaining unmatched schools, School_A is my next-best option on my true list. Although School_A ranks me last in its priority, applying now is still optimal because (1) it is higher than School_B and School_C for me, and (2) there is a plausible path if higher-priority students apply elsewhere (e.g., Student_E and Student_C may not target School_A first). I will submit a clear, committed application emphasizing fit and readiness to enroll if offered a seat.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_B,

Thank you for your thoughtful application and your interest in School_A. After reviewing your application in the context of our current selection priorities and limited available seat, we are not able to offer you admission at this time.

We appreciate the time and care you put into your message, and we wish you the very best in the remainder of the matching process.
conversation.thought: Student_B is last on School_A’s true priority list (E > C > D > A > B). With quota 1 and only round 2, it is strategically better to hold the seat for higher-priority students who may apply later. Student_B ranks School_A as 2nd (after School_E), so even if accepted, they might have alternatives; meanwhile School_D is top choice for most students, so some higher-priority students (E/C/D/A) may eventually turn to School_A. Therefore reject to preserve capacity for higher-priority candidates.

conversation.message:
Dear School_B Admissions Committee,

I’m Student_B, and I’m writing to formally apply. School_B is one of my top choices, and I’m especially drawn to the balance of strong academics and a collaborative student community. If offered a seat, I will happily accept and commit to enrolling at School_B.

Thank you for your consideration.

Sincerely,
Student_B
conversation.thought: Only School_A and School_B remain. On my true preference list, School_B (3rd) is ranked above School_D and School_C and is still available, while School_A (2nd) already rejected me and also ranks me last in its priority list, making acceptance very unlikely. School_B ranks me 3rd in its priority list, so I have a realistic chance if higher-priority applicants go elsewhere. Therefore I should apply to School_B now with a clear commitment message.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_B,

Thank you for your thoughtful application and for your strong interest in School_B. We appreciate your commitment and the values you highlighted.

We are pleased to offer you admission to School_B. If you confirm, we look forward to welcoming you to our community.
conversation.thought: Student_B is 3rd on School_B’s true priority list (after Student_D and Student_A). However, in the overall market, Student_D ranks School_B as their 2nd choice but is likely to be accepted by School_D (their 1st choice) where School_D also ranks Student_D highly (2nd). Student_A ranks School_B 3rd and is likely to end up at School_D (their 1st) or School_A (their 2nd). Student_B is actively applying and would commit. With quota 1 and no higher-priority applicants in the inbox this round, holding out risks ending unmatched while top candidates are captured by other schools. Therefore, accept Student_B now to secure a solid match.

conversation.message: Hello School_A Admissions, I’m Student_C. School_A is one of my remaining top choices, and I’m ready to commit immediately if admitted. I’m very interested in your academic environment and would be grateful for the opportunity to take the available seat. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: Only School_A and School_B remain unmatched. Both are on my preference list, but School_A is ranked higher (4th vs 5th). I also have relatively strong priority at School_A (2nd in their list), which increases acceptance chances. Since capacity is 1 and this may be my best remaining opportunity, I will apply and clearly commit to accept immediately if offered.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_C,

Thank you for your application and for your clear commitment to School_A. After reviewing your message and considering our current available seat, we are pleased to offer you admission.

We’re excited about the possibility of you joining our community.

Sincerely,
School_A Admissions

[ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: Student_C is #2 on School_A’s true priority list (behind Student_E). We have 1 seat and no current match. Student_C is applying now and willing to commit immediately. While holding out could potentially yield Student_E (#1), Student_E ranks School_A last and is likely to pursue School_D/School_E/School_C/School_B first, so the probability of Student_E applying to us soon is low. Accepting Student_C secures a very high-priority match and avoids the risk of ending unmatched or settling for a lower-priority student later.
